Package CCDD

Class CcddUtilities

java.lang.Object
CCDD.CcddUtilities
public class CcddUtilities extends Object
CFS Command and Data Dictionary utilities class

      array2 - Second array to compare
      Returns:

    • addEmbeddedQuotes

      protected static String addEmbeddedQuotes(String text)
      Repeat any embedded double quotes, then bound the supplied text with double quotes
      Parameters:
      text - Text string for which to add double quotes; a null string is replaced by a blank
      Returns:
      The supplied text string with any embedded double quotes repeated, and bounded with double quotes

    • addEmbeddedQuotesAndCommas

      protected static String addEmbeddedQuotesAndCommas(String... texts)
      For each of the supplied text strings repeat any embedded double quotes, then bound with double quotes and separate each result with a comma
      Parameters:
      texts - Text string(s) for which to add double quotes and comma-separate
      Returns:
      Each of the supplied text strings with any embedded double quotes repeated, then bound with double quotes and separate each result with a comma

    • splitAndRemoveQuotes

      protected static String[] splitAndRemoveQuotes(String text)
      Split the supplied text string into an array, divided at commas, ignoring commas within quotes. Remove the excess double quotes from the array members
      Parameters:
      text - Text string to split
      Returns:
      Text string divided into separate components, split at commas (including any surrounding white space characters), accounting for commas within double quotes, and with the excess double quotes removed

    • splitAndRemoveQuotes

      protected static String[] splitAndRemoveQuotes(String text, String separator, int limit, boolean removeQuotes)
      Split the supplied text string into an array, divided at the specified separator character(s), ignoring the separator character(s) within quotes. Remove the excess double quotes from the array members
      Parameters:
      text - Text string to split
      separator - Character(s) at which to split the text
      limit - Maximum number of parts to separate the text into. This is the number of parts returned, with any missing parts returned as blanks. Set to -1 to split the text into as many parts as there are separators in the text
      removeQuotes - True to remove excess double quotes from the individual array members
      Returns:
      Text string divided into separate components, split at commas, accounting for commas within double quotes, and with the excess double quotes removed

    • convertArrayToStringTruncate

      protected static String convertArrayToStringTruncate(String[] itemArray)
      Convert the supplied array of text items into a single string with the items separated by commas. If the length of the string exceeds a specified maximum then shorten the string to the maximum, find the last comma, truncate the string, and add an indication of how many other items are in the list
      Parameters:
      itemArray - Array of text items to combine
      Returns:
      The array of text items converted to a single, comma-separated string, and shortened if above a maximum length

    • parseCommandLine

      protected static String[] parseCommandLine(String argString)
      Separate a command line string into an array of arguments. Account for quoting (single and double) of arguments within the string
      Parameters:
      argString - Command line argument string
      Returns:
      Array containing the separate command line arguments with any quotes removed

    • getEnumeratedValueSeparator

      protected static String getEnumeratedValueSeparator(String enumeration)
      Determine the character that separates an enumeration value from its corresponding label
      Parameters:
      enumeration - enumeration in the format <enum value><enum value separator><enum label>[<enum value separator>...][<enum group separator>...]
      Returns:
      Character that separates an enumeration value from its corresponding label

    • getEnumerationGroupSeparator

      protected static String getEnumerationGroupSeparator(String enumeration, String enumValueSeparator)
      Determine the character that separates the enumerated groups
      Parameters:
      enumeration - enumeration in the format <enum value><enum value separator><enum label>[<enum value separator>...][<enum group separator>...]
      enumValueSeparator - Character used to separate an enumeration value from its corresponding label
      Returns:
      Character that separates the enumerated groups; null if no separator is found

    • removeHTMLTags

      protected static String removeHTMLTags(String text)
      Replace any HTML break tags with spaces, remove the remaining HTML tag(s) from the supplied text, and replace special character markers with the special character if recognized, else with a blank
      Parameters:
      text - String from which to remove the HTML tags
      Returns:
      Input string with spaces replacing breaks, minus any HTML tag(s), and with special character markers replaced

    • removeHTMLTags

      protected static String removeHTMLTags(String text, boolean preserveBreaks)
      Replace any HTML break tags with line feeds or spaces (depending on the input flag), remove the remaining HTML tag(s) from the supplied text, and replace special character markers with the special character if recognized, else with a blank
      Parameters:
      text - String from which to remove the HTML tags
      preserveBreaks - True to replace breaks with line feeds; false to replace breaks with spaces
      Returns:
      Input string with line feeds or spaces replacing breaks, minus any HTML tag(s), and with special character markers replaced

    • colorHTMLText

      protected static String colorHTMLText(String text, Color color)
      Add the HTML tags to the supplied text to change the font color to the one specified
      Parameters:
      text - String to which to apply the HTML tags
      color - Color to which to set the text (Color)
      Returns:
      Input string with the HTML tags to alter the color to the one supplied

      Escape any PostgreSQL reserved characters in the supplied string so that when used in a regular expression the characters are recognized properly
      Parameters:
      text - String in which to escape any reserved characters
      Returns:
      String with any reserved PostgreSQL characters escaped so that they are recognized by a regular expression

    • convertToHTML

      Convert the supplied text string to HTML, replacing the HTML special characters in the text string with the equivalent HTML tags
      Parameters:
      inputText - String to format for HTML
      Returns:
      Input string converted to HTML format

    • convertToHTML

      protected static String convertToHTML(String inputText, boolean ignoreBreaks)
      Convert the supplied text string to HTML, replacing the HTML special characters in the text string with the equivalent HTML tags
      Parameters:
      inputText - String to format for HTML
      ignoreBreaks - True to ignore replacing line feeds with breaks; false to replace line feeds with breaks
      Returns:
      Input string converted to HTML format

    • contains

      protected static boolean contains(String text, List<String> list)
      Search a string list for the specified text string, ignoring case
      Parameters:
      text - Text string to search for in the list
      list - String list to search through for the specified text
      Returns:
      True if the specified text string is present in the supplied list (case insensitive)

    • wrapText

      protected static String wrapText(String inputText, int maxLength)
      Insert line breaks into the supplied string so as to limit the maximum length of each line to the value specified. If the supplied string is formatted for HTML then the HTML tags are removed prior to determining the line breaks insertion position(s). Once the line breaks are added the HTML tags are restored. A non-HTML input string is converted to HTML format, including conversion of any special characters
      Parameters:
      inputText - String to format for wrapping
      maxLength - Maximum length, in characters, to wrap the text
      Returns:
      The input text, converted to HTML format (if not already), with line breaks inserted to limit the line length to the maximum specified; null if the input string is null or blank

    • highlightDataType

      protected static String highlightDataType(String path)
      Highlight the data type portion of a structure table/variable path
      Parameters:
      path - Structure/variable path
      Returns:
      Structure/variable path with the data type(s) highlighted

    • highlightSearchText

      protected static boolean highlightSearchText(Component component, String text, Color hightlightColor, Pattern searchPattern)
      Highlight any text matching the search text in the the specified text component
      Parameters:
      component - Reference to the table cell renderer component
      text - Cell value
      hightlightColor - Color used for highlighting the matching text
      searchPattern - Search pattern; can be a regular expression (Pattern)
      Returns:
      True if the supplied text contains a match to the specified search pattern

      Parameters:

      parent - GUI component over which to center the dialog

    • updateRememberedItemList

      protected static void updateRememberedItemList(String text, List<String> itemList, int maxItems)
      Update the list of remembered items with the specified string. This is used by the search and server auto-completion lists, and by the lists of previously opened projects and tables
      Parameters:
      text - Item to add to the list. The item is placed at the head of the list. The list size is constrained to the maximum number specified when the field was created
      itemList - List containing the items
      maxItems - Maximum number of items allowed in the list

    • getRememberedItemListAsString

      protected static String getRememberedItemListAsString(List<String> itemList)
      Get the list of remembered items as a single, delimited string. This is used by the search and server auto-completion lists, and by the lists of previously opened projects and tables
      Parameters:
      itemList - List containing the items to combine into a single string
      Returns:
      String containing the items from which the text is extracted, separated by delimiter characters
